intro: Pistacia lentiscus, commonly known as mastic tree or mastic bush, is a flowering plant in the Anacardiaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces a resin known as mastic, which has been used for centuries in various traditional applications. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous areas. The leaves are leathery and glossy, contributing to its ornamental value in landscaping.
